reviews.sentence: Hilton Sucks. I visited the hotel on July 17 19. The hotel was very busy and we had a great first night. Our second day there was quite different. We had attended an outside wedding in the evening. It had been quite hot and buggy. We were looking forward to getting back to the hotel to swim outside. We arrived at the pool and made note that the pool was open to 11 pm. We had an hour and 15 minutes to swim. My family was the only people using the outside pool. It was quiet. Not 5 minutes in to our swim we were bombarded with 15 children ranging in ages 5 14. They were not supervised by any parent in the pool area. Which was a rule stated by the hotel. There was a child who could not swim and needed help from my husband. These children were irresponsible disrespectful and unsafe. 5 minutes later the manager in duty spook with my husband and said the pool was closing because of our unruly children. My husband told him that the group of children were not with us. The manager found the parents of the children and closed the outside pool at 10 pm. I went and spoke with the manager regarding the closing of the pool. He said sorry but it was his discretion to close the pool. He did not want to deal with the unruly children or their parents. He took the easy way out and punished us by closing the pool. We returned to our room and decided to go and get a snack at the restaurant. The manager came and spoke to us again. He had noted that the pool was a problem in Friday night as well and was closed early too. He comped our snacks. Upon our checkout the next morning the front desk never asked how our stay was or even said good morning. I called Doubletree and spoke with customer service. The agent agreed that it was an unfortunate incident and agreed to refund one nights stay. She put me him hold and returned and said she could not do it because the same manager I dealt with did not want to give credit. He said he would give me 45. What a joke. I have always stayed at Hilton on our trips. I will never stay at Hilton again. This was the worst customer service ever.

H member no breaks. On our most recent stay here at the DoubleTree in Syracuse it was better than the last but not up to Hilton expectations. We waited to check in. Which was no big deal. But I was surprised that seeing how I called shed to verify we had have extra towels. The room was two double beds. I figured at least 4 would be there but the shower curtain here seems to soak the floor requiring multiple towels to soak up the water. Checking the bathroom was a disappointment. Two bath hand towels and zero washcloths. I did not want to seem like I was asking them agin but requesting them in the rest action and calling head you had think more than two bath towels would not have been o much trouble to accommodate a loyal H member with. Where has there standards gone. Apparently out the door my last three Hilton stays. Hilton needs o up their game to compete with other brands far less pricy for the same quality of service.

Nice hotel but could use a few things. We went to Syracuse to visit relatives and to attend a concert. I could not believe that there was not any microwaves in any of the rooms. None anywhere except in gift shop. Also no vending machines on any of the floors. Restaurant was nice but very expensive. Rooms were nice and pool was nice and clean. Lots of business rooms and places to have group meeting and such. Easy access to the Carrier Circle.

Average. The hotel is beautiful. The staff is friendly and courteous. They will not accommodate an early check in. They leave minimal supplies in the room for bathing wr had to call each day for aditonal towels and wash clothes. You have to use rhe towels from your room for the pool too. The hotel is cleaned average with the exception of the bathroom. The floors were filthy the dust and hair on the word work were in abundance. The price of food is ridiculous. No refrigerator or microwave in the room. The ice machines could not keep up with the amount of people needing ice evidently as it was our of ice by 9 am. All in all an average stay for a bit more price.

250 for lobby coffee. No I love Doubletree hotels. I am always seeking them out as a preference when I travel for pleasure or business. In fact I have stayed at this Doubletree many times. Never ever have I been charged for lobby coffee. They have a guard type person manning the lobby coffee charging 250 per 12 ounce cup. I have never been impressed by the food or lack of customer service at the restaurant in this doubletree so I choose not to utilize it. Maybe this outrageous charge for lobby coffee is part of the new renovations. I really think they should rethink this as it is a cheap and rather embarrassing experience when you go to grab a coffee and the security guard informs you that you owe 250. It is not that I can not afford it but when all hotels including doubletree hotels have always had complementary lobby coffee it becomes very strange. I will be choosing a different hotel for my frequent Syracuse stays from now on. Poor customer service.

Poorly maintained and poor service. This used to be a good place to stay but the property is very poorly maintained and the room service staff does not deliver. They actually asked me to pick up my room service. Breakfast pricing is also meant to trip you up. I will never stay there again.
I recommend. Nice Place. Hilton Honors perks appreciated. Got a great deal through Hotelscom. Only 80 on a Summer Saturday night. Worth a lot more than that.

We are Hilton Honors Members beautiful property with ok service. However our neighbors were partying till the wee hours of the morning. We called the front desk TWICE and nothing was done. We got 3 hrs of sleep. Sharing a balcony is not ok with partying neighbors with nothing being done. This was the worst stay we ever had. The Hotel offered some extra points but we never got them.

Decent Hotel. My wife and I attended a recognition event here a couple of weeks ago. Because the event was in the evening we stayed the night. Our room was okay. The shower was not good with limited hot water. I did not think that type of thing happened anymore but it did. The bed was okay but not great. The room itself was kind of noisy because directly across from us was the HVAC system for some of the event halls. And we were on the Hilton Honors floor which are supposed to be the best rooms. The TV however was huge. No problem seeing that. The price was low so I really can not complain. The recognition event itself was quite nice and the dinner they served was very good. Overall I have to rate the experience average. It was not bad but it was not memorable either.

Double Trees always nice. Excellent hotel only thing I did not like was how far you had to walk from the front doors of hotel to the elevators. At least 50 60 yards. My wife has MS and it was a struggle for her to get in and out of hotel. Not a good hotel if you have limited mobility.
Updated hotel. Nice and quiet even with wedding receptions going on.
Very nice hotel and very helpful staff.

Highly disappointed. Our sheets were n’t changed one day after my son had an accident. Got back to the room and it was still wet. Called and asked for new sheets to be out on and a security guard brought them to me and just dumped them into my arms saying “ here ya go ” and walked off. The shuttle driver was involved in an accident with us in the vehicle and we were never checked on by management. Room was musty and extremely cramped. And to top it off 18 for adult child breakfast is ludacris. Embassy Suites and Hampton Inn both offer breakfast Hampton is free and embassy suites is 9.

Exceptional Customer Experience. Hotel staff very helpful. Driver Tom was amazing super kind and provided information about the hotel and crew discounts. Offered to make any stops prior to arrival of hotel. Restaurant food quality was good the staff was very friendly. The hotel rooms were spacious and clean. Amenities in the room were very useful. Overall rating of the hotel and staff is a 10.

Great stay for a group. Stayed with a basketball team for a tournament in Syracuse. Great services available and convenient location for access to many areas of the city. Lobby services were great nice bar and lounge area. Rooms were very clean and decent size.

Awesome Customer Service. I stayed overnight Feb 9 10th because of an event I was attending the next day. I like that this hotel is close to everything but far enough away from downtown that you do not get that crowd or traffic. especially since there was a game the night I arrived. I decided to stay within the hotel to get dinner after arriving. The bar restaurant is located right near the lobby and is beautiful. The bar has a great selection of beers wines and cocktails. The menu has a variety of choices with fair prices and portion sizes. Ivan at the bar is beyond amazing. I can not say that enough. He is the definition of Hilton Doubletree standards and customer service. I never felt so special and taken care of before. He made awesome suggestions for food made you feel comfortable and welcome and showed that he truly loved his job. He had asked what I was in town for and suggested I use the hotels shuttle service. He even told the front desk supervisor that I may be using the service and to let the shuttle driver know. He also made great suggestions of places to go and see within town. Throughout the night I was also able to meet the hotels general manager. It was awesome to see him engaged within the hotel especially on a Saturday night with events going on. He introduced himself to me and welcomed me to the property. The front desk supervisor was very friendly and made every accommodation I needed from a later check out time to arranging the shuttle service in the morning. Room service was excellent the next morning. I decided to use the door hanger menu in order to get breakfast in the morning. It was more than enough reasonably priced and delivered right on time. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I would defintely stay again.

Nice place to stay. Very clean pleasant employees very beautiful inside. The bathroom was small but the room overall was nice and clean. Breakfast was good a little pricey for breakfast. Bartender is awesome. I am local in Syracuse and I will definitely go back just to get away.
Had a nice little bar and friendly staff.

Stay in Syracuse Doubletree. Stay in Syracuse was very nice beds were excellent. Fridge was not working at first and was not aware until 24 hours passed by no microwave in room. overall room was excellent with beds and room cleanness and staff.

I have not stayed in a Doubletree in some time and it will go back low on my list of places to stay. I was in a handicapped room which if I had to use any assistive devices it would have been a great challenge. The room is small and tight. Miss not having a microwave so if you expect one be prepared. Cobwebs and mold are easily visable. Towels looked old. I am guessing that maybe this room is not used often. I had dinner in the cafe would not recommend the food. Overpriced and not appealing. Best asset here are their staff. Professional and friendly. Staff are very warm and accommodating.
